page.title: 03LAND USE AND VEGETATION
page.content: Using the 1:50,000 O.S. map sheet 192 First Series, an estimate for the land use of the block is : WOODLAND 32% FARMLAND 64% HEATH 2% ROADS & BUILDS. 2% The Ministry of Agriculture Land Classification makes most of the land Grade 3 with the Greensand hill tops Grade 4 agricultural land. Nearly all the farmland is permanent pasture. Cattle, sheep, pigs and horses being the most common farm animals observed. Some fodder crops such as turnips and barley are also grown and there has been an increase of land under the plough in recent years. The woodland is mainly coniferous with larch and spruce the most common tree. There is also a rich mixture of deciduous woodland. Refuse dump in 1595 disused.
